channel.title: Shop Prices
channel.description: Alright i want an item to be less valuable when selling to shop but the regular price when buying from the shop normal. So say i have an item that cost 10m you can buy from the shop for 10m but sell to the shop for like 7m. How can i make it possible for the shop system to work like that? The shop system at the moment is buy for 10m, sell for 10m. I want the sell value to be less i prefer it like that in a Eco server, any ideas?

item.title: Shop Prices
item.dc:creator: @All_Time_Low All Time Low
item.description:
@All_Time_Low wrote:

Thanks.

Read full topic

item.title: Shop Prices
item.dc:creator: @Skiire Skiire
item.description:
@Skiire wrote:

[quote=“99range pure, post:2, topic:443067”]If this is [pi] based then find prices in your server file.
then find the item you want to change (THE PRICE)
lets say
405
ok look it up
it should look like this

405 WHATEVER AMOUNT - change it.[/quote]

That’s idiotic and will mean he has to change every items sell value independently…

Just find your “sellItem” method and apply a “tax rate” so to speak.

Example (not the actual code, ripped from a random PI):

	public void buyFromShopPrice(final int removeId, final int removeSlot) {
		
		int ShopValue = (int) Math.floor(getItemShopValue(removeId, 0, removeSlot));
		
		ShopValue *= 1.00;
	}

Basic math tells us if we want to decrease the items value we multiply the value by a number less than one.

EX: 2 * .6 = 1.2

Read full topic
